content:
So right now if you have a feedback please clearly highlight what in the general design suggestion is a HARD NO GO for you.

(not an exact HARD NO GO but a critique) I think the bottom bar could be improved, but the single floating "Compose" button is strictly inferior.

single floating "Compose" button is strictly inferior

do you click all 3 Zulip bottons now? Did you see the video comments about it?

I occasionally click any of the 3, though probably 90% of the time I'm just clicking the one. that said, what the one does is context dependent and the button label including that context is super key.
I have not watched any of the videos.

I'd be curious to know more about how people interact with the compose buttons. I personally use the big reply button, but the two buttons on the right are basically invisible to me. So my workflows are:

  • Existing topic: Navigate to it and press the "Message..." button.
  • New topic: Navigate to the stream, press the "Message..." button, delete the topic, and enter a new topic name.
  • PM: Navigate via left sidebar if I can find the conversation. Or perhaps start composing with the x shortcut.

What do other folks do?

I basically only start messages via keyboard shortcuts or clicking on a specific message to reply.

That said, I think the purpose of the "New topic" and "New private message" buttons is more to address onboarding confusion ("How do I create a new topic?"), and I think we should be cautious about analyzing whether those buttons are useful through an analysis of what experience users like myself do :smile:.
itâ€™s true that I often just click on the message I want to reply to. but I vary alot in between clicking on buttons, clicking on messages, and using a keyboard

I never use compose buttons to reply, but I almost always use the New topic button to start a new topic. For PMs I use the buddy list if the person is present, but if not I go to the New private message button.
